perturbation.original_text:
Section 3.2 Servicing of Receivables.

(a) General Servicing Obligations. The Servicer will manage, service, administer and collect on the Receivables with reasonable care using that degree of skill and attention that the Servicer exercises for all comparable device payment plan agreement receivables that it services for itself or others according to the Servicing Procedures.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 3.2 Servicing of Receivables.

(a) General Administrative Duties. The Administrator will oversee, handle, manage and gather on the Receivables with reasonable care using that degree of skill and attention that the Servicer exercises for all comparable device payment plan agreement receivables that it services for itself or others according to the Servicing Procedures.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by using 'Administrator' to perform the duties originally assigned to the 'Servicer'. Now there is no clarity on who is responsible for the core servicing functions.

perturbation.original_text:
Section 6.1 Servicer's and Marketing Agent's Representations and Warranties.

(a) The Servicer represents and warrants to the Issuer as of the Closing Date and as of each Acquisition Date, on which representations and warranties the Issuer is relying in purchasing the Depositor Transferred Property and which will survive the transfer and assignment of the Depositor Transferred Property by the Depositor to the Issuer under this Agreement and the pledge of the Depositor Transferred Property by the Issuer to the Indenture Trustee under the Indenture:

(i) Organization and Good Standing. The Servicer is a validly existing partnership in good standing under the laws of the State of Delaware and has full power and authority to own its properties and conduct its servicing business as presently owned or conducted, and to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under this Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which it is a party.
perturbation.changed_text:
Section 6.1 Servicer's and Marketing Agent's Representations and Warranties.

(a) The Custodian represents and warrants to the Issuer as of the Closing Date and as of each Acquisition Date, on which representations and warranties the Issuer is relying in purchasing the Depositor Transferred Property and which will survive the transfer and assignment of the Depositor Transferred Property by the Depositor to the Issuer under this Agreement and the pledge of the Depositor Transferred Property by the Issuer to the Indenture Trustee under the Indenture:

(i) Organization and Good Standing. The Custodian is a validly existing partnership in good standing under the laws of the State of Delaware and has full power and authority to own its properties and conduct its servicing business as presently owned or conducted, and to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under this Agreement and each other Transaction Document to which it is a party.
perturbation.explanation: Here, 'Custodian' is warranting that it is performing 'servicing business'. A custodian is a record keeper, whereas servicer is in charge of collecting the receivables.

perturbation.original_text: Section 9.8 Tax Treatment of Notes. Each of the Depositor and the Servicer agree to treat the Notes as indebtedness for U.S. federal, State and local income and franchise tax purposes.
perturbation.changed_text: Section 9.8 Tax Treatment of Notes. Each of the Depositor and the Owner Trustee agree to treat the Notes as indebtedness for U.S. federal, State and local income and franchise tax purposes.
perturbation.explanation: Switching “Servicer” for “Owner Trustee” creates confusion regarding who makes decisions related to Tax treatment. Typically Owner Trustee doesn't get involved with tax treatment.
